author: Special Correspondent
text:
Officials and employees of various government departments drafted for election work were imparted training in Model Code of Conduct at the District Collectorate on Thursday.

In the backdrop of the district administration constituting a Monitoring Committee and a Flying Squad in each of its eight Assembly segments, and start of the control room for receiving and acting on complaints, District Collector S. Prabakar apprised the staff about the procedures involved in granting permission for conduct of political processions and meetings, and evaluating the expenditure incurred by political parties and candidates based on the newspaper and television advertisements, the use of lighting, chairs, audio equipment, and vehicles. Teams that would include police personnel and videographers would carry out surprise vehicle checks and keep the control room informed about the developments. Superintendent of Police M.R. Sibi Chakravarthy, Gobi Sub-Collector Krishnan Unni also took part.
title: Training in model code of conduct
